info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 20 at 4:16PM MST by NWS Flagstaff AZ
info.description:
At 416 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Black Canyon City, or 37 miles southeast of Prescott, moving east at 20 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible.
Locations impacted include... Black Canyon City, Sunset Point Rest Area, Horse Thief Basin, Coles Bay, Humbug Bay, Castle Hot Springs, Goose Bay, Agua Fria National Monument, Lake Pleasant, Castle Creek Boat Ramp, Cottonwood Day Use Area, Rock Springs, Bumble Bee, Castle Creek Wilderness, Humbug and Casa Rosa.
This includes Interstate 17 between mile markers 242 and 254.
This includes the following recreation areas and campgrounds... Turney Gulch Group Campground, Hazlett Hollow Campground and Black Canyon Campground.
info.instruction:
Monitor the weather situation closely and be alert for threatening weather conditions.
Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

parameter.value: A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT YAVAPAI COUNTY UNTIL 445 PM MST

area.areaDesc: Yavapai County Mountains; Yavapai County Valleys and Basins
